page.title: 02 LANDSCAPE OF PAXFORD AREA
page.content: The Paxford area presents a view of gently rising land including the valley of the River Cam,an escarpment rising to 156m running from East to West across the area and two villages, Paxford and Ebrington. From Marfurlong Farm one can see buildings including glasshouses, a network of 15_20acre fields enclosed by hedges,Charingworth Manor on horizon amongst conifers and a ridge rising East with more glasshouses half _way up.Pudlicott Mill lies along the valley where the Cam crosses Campden_Shipston road. From Briar Hill Farm northwards lies Campden Research Station beside the railway line.To the East Paxford is surrounded by trees.On Southwest slopes of Ebrington are two imposing rows of poplar trees.
